Ancient Egytian Calculations

  1. Use the following example to explain how the ancient Egyptian method of multiplying two numbers (in this case: \(15\cdot 659\)) works.


  2. Using the ancient Egyptian method, solve the division task \(1219:23\). The first and last line of the solution is already given below.

  3. Using \(180:27\) as an example, explain why not all division tasks can be solved in this way, even if you allow unit fractions in the form \(\frac {1}{2^n}\).
